intro: Guenthera subscaposa subsp. imdrahsiana, commonly known as the Imdrahsian guenthera, is a rare and endemic plant species found in specific regions of Southeast Asia. It is a herbaceous plant characterized by its slender, ascending stems and small, clustered leaves. The flowers are typically white or pale pink, with five petals and a distinct central stamen. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
